javelin.controller.challenge

Class ChallengeRatingCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.challenge.ChallengeRatingCalculator

  • public class ChallengeRatingCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Determines a Monster.challengeRating according to the rules of Upper Krust's work, which is repackaged with permission on the 'doc' directory. His reference is used to the best of my abilities but has been adapted in a few cases due to programming complexity and artificial intelligence efficiency. Such cases should be documented in Javadoc. #see CrFactor

    • Method Detail

      • calculateCr

        public static float calculateCr(Monster monster)
        See "challenging challenge ratings" source document (@ 'doc' folder), page 1: "HOW DO FACTORS WORK?". The silver rule isn't computed for at this stage the plan is not to use the PHB classes - may change though TODO This is intended more for human-readable CR, if you need to make calculation you might prefer calculaterawcr(Monster).
        Parameters:
        monster - Unit to rate.
        Returns:
        The calculated CR.

      • calculaterawcr

        public static float[] calculaterawcr(Monster monster)
        Unlike calculateCr(Monster) this method doesn't roundfraction(float) or translatecr(float), making it more suitable for more precise calculations.
        Parameters:
        monster - Unit whose CR is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        An array where index 0 is the sum of all CR_FACTORS and 1 is the same after the golden rule has been aplied.
